metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5829 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple heap-based buffer overflows in the hiddev_ioctl_usage function indrivers/hid/usbhid/hiddev.c in the Linux kernel through 4.6.3 allow localusers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via a crafted (1) HIDIOCGUSAGES or (2) HIDIOCSUSAGES ioctl call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-36.55
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-36.55
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-36.55
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1021-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1021.27
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1024-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1024.27
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-36.55').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1021.27').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1024.27').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
